it.polimi.se2019.limperio.nicotera.italia.controller

Class CatchController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.limperio.nicotera.italia.controller.CatchController

  • class CatchController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all of the operations concerning the catch actions of the players
    Author:
    Francesco Nicotera

    • Method Detail

      • replyToRequestToCatch

        void replyToRequestToCatch(ClientEvent event)

        This method replies to a catch request by the player;

        It finds the squares where the player can catch and then it sends to virtual view an event in order to show to the player these squares and the objects that it can catch

        Parameters:
        event - it contains the information of the player that want to catch

      • handleCatching

        void handleCatching(SelectionSquare event)

        Handles the catch request of a player.

        If the player wanted to catch in a normal square, the method will update the ammo and the player's board If the player wanted to catch in a spawn square , the method will create a new event in which it asks to the player which weapon it want to catch

        Parameters:
        event - Contains the coordinates of the square in which the player want to catch and the player's nickname

      • sendNotifyAfterCatching

        private void sendNotifyAfterCatching(Player player)
        Sends the update of the map and the player board of the player that has caught after the catch action.
        Parameters:
        player - The player involved in the catch action.

      • addAmmoToPlayer

        private void addAmmoToPlayer(PlayerBoard playerBoard,
                             java.util.ArrayList<ColorOfCard_Ammo> ammoCaught)
        Adds to a player the ammo it has caught;
        Parameters:
        playerBoard - the player's board that has to be updated
        ammoCaught - the list of ammo that are caught

      • findSquareWherePlayerCanCatch

        java.util.ArrayList<Square> findSquareWherePlayerCanCatch(Player player,
                                                          java.util.ArrayList<ServerEvent.AliasCard> weaponNotAffordable)

        This method return the squares in which the player can catch something.

        When the method analyzes the squares, when it finds a spawn square, it fills the second parameter with the weapons contained in that square that can not be caught because of lack of ammo by the player

        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to catch
        weaponNotAffordable - this list is filled by the method with the weapons the player can't catch because of lack of ammo
        Returns:
        A list of squares that contains the positions in which the player can catch something

      • findSquaresWithSomethingToCatch

        private void findSquaresWithSomethingToCatch(Player player,
                                             java.util.ArrayList<Square> listOfSquares,
                                             java.util.ArrayList<Square> squaresWithSomething,
                                             java.util.ArrayList<ServerEvent.AliasCard> weaponNotAffordable)
        From a list of squares, it fills another one in which there are only the squares in which there is something that can be caught
        Parameters:
        player - the player that want to catch
        listOfSquares - the beginning list
        squaresWithSomething - the ending list in which there are only the useful squares
        weaponNotAffordable - the weapons that aren't affordable by the player

      • findSquaresWherePlayerCanCatchInFrenzyMode

        private java.util.ArrayList<Square> findSquaresWherePlayerCanCatchInFrenzyMode(Player player,
                                                                               java.util.ArrayList<ServerEvent.AliasCard> weaponNotAffordable,
                                                                               java.util.ArrayList<Square> listOfSquareReachable)
        Has the same role of findSquareWherePlayerCanCatch method, but this one finds the reachable squares in frenzy mode
        Parameters:
        player - that want to catch
        weaponNotAffordable - list of weapons that aren't affordable by player
        listOfSquareReachable - the final list in which at the end there are the reachable squares
        Returns:
        listOfSquareReachable

      • handleSelectionWeaponToCatch

        void handleSelectionWeaponToCatch(SelectionWeaponToCatch event)
        Adds to player's deck the weapon that the player want to catch
        Parameters:
        event - contains the player's nickname, the coordinates of the spawn square in which the player want to catch and the name of the weapon

      • addWeaponCardToPlayerDeck

        private void addWeaponCardToPlayerDeck(Player player,
                                       java.lang.String nameOfWeaponCard)
        Adds to the weapon cards deck of the player a weapon card handling the payment for the weapond.
        Parameters:
        player - Player that is trying to catch the weapon.
        nameOfWeaponCard - The name of the weapon to catch.

      • findPowerUpOfThisColor

        PowerUpCard findPowerUpOfThisColor(Player player,
                                   ColorOfCard_Ammo color)
        Getd the power up card of the color specified through the parameter.
        Parameters:
        player - The player owner of the power up cards deck where is looking for a card.
        color - The color of the card that is looking for with.
        Returns:
        The power up card of the color specified in the deck.

      • sendRequestToDiscardPowerUpCard

        private void sendRequestToDiscardPowerUpCard(Player player,
                                             java.util.ArrayList<ColorOfCard_Ammo> colorsOfAmmoNotEnough)
        Sends to the player a reqeust to discard a power up card to pay the caught of a weapon.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that is involved in the catch action.
        colorsOfAmmoNotEnough - The color of which there are not enough ammo usable.

      • handleRequestToDiscardPowerUpCardAsAmmo

        void handleRequestToDiscardPowerUpCardAsAmmo(DiscardPowerUpCard event)
        Handles the selection of the power up card to discard by the player and calls again the method to send the request to discard, if needed, another power up card.
        Parameters:
        event - The event received by the client.

      • findPowerUpCard

        PowerUpCard findPowerUpCard(java.lang.String nameOfPowerUpCard,
                            ColorOfCard_Ammo colorOfCard,
                            Player player)
        Gets the power up card in the deck of a player starting from its name and its color passed by parameter.
        Returns:
        The power up card in the deck of the player with the name and color passed by parameter.

      • getPowerUpCardToChooseForDiscard

        java.util.ArrayList<ServerEvent.AliasCard> getPowerUpCardToChooseForDiscard(Player player,
                                                                            ColorOfCard_Ammo color)
        Gets the list of power up card discardable to pay the price of a weapon.
        Parameters:
        player - Player that wants to catch a weapon.
        color - The color of which is looking for the power up cards.
        Returns:
        The list of alias cards representing the power up cards usable for the payment.

      • getColorsOfAmmoNotEnough

        java.util.ArrayList<ColorOfCard_Ammo> getColorsOfAmmoNotEnough(Player player,
                                                               ColorOfCard_Ammo[] priceToBuy)
        Gets the list of color of which there are not enough usable ammo to pay the price.
        Parameters:
        player - Player that wants to catch a weapon.
        priceToBuy - The price to pay.
        Returns:
        A list of color representing the color of ammo not enough to complete the payment.

      • isAffordableOnlyWithAmmo

        boolean isAffordableOnlyWithAmmo(Player player,
                                 ColorOfCard_Ammo[] priceToBuy)
        Check if a price can be payed only with ammo or not.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that has to pay.
        priceToBuy - The price to pay.
        Returns:
        True if the price is payable only with ammo, false otherwise.

      • findSpawnSquareWithThisCard

        private Square findSpawnSquareWithThisCard(java.lang.String nameOfWeaponCard)
        Gets the spawn square that contains the weapon card with the name passed by parameter.
        Returns:
        The spawn square that contains the weapon card.

      • handleSelectionWeaponToCatchAfterDiscard

        void handleSelectionWeaponToCatchAfterDiscard(SelectionWeaponToDiscard event)
        Handles the ultimate phase of the catch action where to catch a weapon the player had to discard one of his.
        Parameters:
        event - Event received by client.

      • changeWeaponCardsBetweenSquareAndDeck

        private void changeWeaponCardsBetweenSquareAndDeck(Player player,
                                                   java.lang.String nameOfWeaponCardToRemoveFromTheSquare,
                                                   java.lang.String nameOfWeaponCardToAddToTheSquare)
        Handles the change between the weapon that the player wants to catch and the weapon he wants to discard.
        Parameters:
        player - Player that wants to do the change of weapon.
        nameOfWeaponCardToRemoveFromTheSquare - The name of the weapon card that the player wants to catch from the spawn square.
        nameOfWeaponCardToAddToTheSquare - The name of the weapon card that the player wants to discard and that will return on the spawn square.

      • addWeaponNotAffordable

        void addWeaponNotAffordable(SpawnSquare square,
                            Player player,
                            java.util.ArrayList<ServerEvent.AliasCard> weaponNotAffordable)
        This method fills the array that is passed with the weapons that the player can't catch in the square because of lack of ammo
        Parameters:
        square - the spawn square in which the player would like to catch weapons
        player - the player that want to catch
        weaponNotAffordable - the list that, at the end of the method, will contain the weapons that can't be caught

      • weaponIsAffordableByPlayer

        private boolean weaponIsAffordableByPlayer(Player player,
                                           WeaponCard card)
        This method check if a weapon can be caught by a player, that has the ammo that are passed by the first parameter
        Parameters:
        card - the weapon that contains the price that the method has to check if it would be payed with the ammo
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if the ammo are more than the weapon's price

      • frequencyAmmoInPrice

        int frequencyAmmoInPrice(ColorOfCard_Ammo[] price,
                         ColorOfCard_Ammo colorToCheck)
        This method calculates the frequency of a specific color of ammo in the price that is passed
        Parameters:
        price - the price in which the method has to calculate the frequency of a color
        colorToCheck - the color of which the method has to calculate the frequency
        Returns:
        the frequency of the colorToCheck in priceToBuy

                                  ColorOfCard_Ammo colorToCheck,
                                  boolean powerUpCard)
        This method calculates the frequency of ammo that a player can use
        Parameters:
        colorToCheck - the color of the ammo of which the method has to calculate the frequency
        Returns:
        the number of ammo that can be used

        Returns:

        private boolean canCatchSomethingInThisSquare(Square square)
        Checks if in the square there is something the player can be catch
        Parameters:

        Returns:
